thread.title: Officials Say Broken Rail Caused West Virginia Train Derailment
thread.title_full: Officials Say Broken Rail Caused West Virginia Train Derailment - WSJ

author: wsjcom
title: Officials Say Broken Rail Caused West Virginia Train Derailment
text:
MONTGOMERY, W. Va.—A broken rail that wasn’t found on two previous inspections led to a fiery oil train derailment in southern West Virginia in February, federal investigators said Friday.
A CSX train carrying 3 million gallons of Bakken crude derailed Feb. 16 during a snowstorm in Mount Carbon. Twenty-seven of the train’s 109 cars derailed, with 20 cars leaking crude oil.
The Federal Railroad Administration said the broken... To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In
